intro: Greeneocharis circumscissa var. circumscissa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved greenocharis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in dry, open habitats such as sagebrush steppe and grasslands. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are often slightly hairy, and it produces small, greenish-white flowers in late spring. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
